metadata.Title: CVE-2019-19911 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - low
metadata.Description:
There is a DoS vulnerability in Pillow before 6.2.2 caused byFpxImagePlugin.py calling the range function on an unvalidated 32-bitinteger if the number of bands is large. On Windows running 32-bit Python,this results in an OverflowError or MemoryError due to the 2 GB limit.However, on Linux running 64-bit Python this results in the process beingterminated by the OOM killer.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-19911` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

python-imaging - 3.1.2-0ubuntu1.3
python-pil - 3.1.2-0ubuntu1.3
python-pil.imagetk - 3.1.2-0ubuntu1.3
python3-pil - 3.1.2-0ubuntu1.3
python3-pil.imagetk - 3.1.2-0ubuntu1.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: pillow package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.1.2-0ubuntu1.3').
